Class WordCount2

  • java.lang.Object
    • WordCount2

  • public class WordCount2
extends Object
    WordCount2 along with Tree2, TreeNode2, and Getch2 is intended to be a object-oriented conversion of the K&R word counting program (main routine on p. 140).

    This conversion implements the tnode struct as the Tree2 and TreeNode2 classes. It also implements the getch and ungetch functions as the Getch2 class. This is intended to handle chars completely correctly.

    Version:
    20130619
    Author:
    Tom Bylander

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WordCount2() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int getWord(StringBuilder word, Getch2 in)
      getWord stores the next word or non-space character from the Getch2 object into its StringBuilder parameter.
      static void main(String[] args)
      The main method reads every word from standard input, stores it in a binary tree (which remembers how many times each word appears), and prints the words and their counts back out in lexiographic order.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        The main method reads every word from standard input, stores it in a binary tree (which remembers how many times each word appears), and prints the words and their counts back out in lexiographic order.

      • getWord

        public static int getWord(StringBuilder word,
          Getch2 in)
        getWord stores the next word or non-space character from the Getch2 object into its StringBuilder parameter. It returns the int representation of the first character or Getch2.EOF. A word is interpreted as any string of letters delimited by nonletters.
        Parameters:
        word - the buffer for the word
        Returns:
        the first character of the word or Getch2.EOF.
